title: 4-Nuss-Florentiner
ingredients: 250 ml heavy cream or crème fine
100 g milk chocolate or dark chocolate
instructions: In a pot, slowly bring the cream, butter, syrup, and sugar to a boil while stirring. Add the nuts, mix well, bring to a boil again, and remove from heat. Stir in the flour and let the mixture cool. Using a teaspoon, place mounds on baking sheets lined with parchment paper. Bake in a preheated oven at about 180°C for 8-10 minutes until golden brown. Remove from parchment and let cool thoroughly. Melt the chocolate and drop dollops on the parchment; carefully place the cookies on top and let dry. Once the chocolate sets, the Florentiners can be easily removed from the parchment. In a cookie jar, the cookies will last about 4 weeks. You can vary the nuts as desired, e.g., use fewer almonds and more hazelnuts, but the specified combination tastes best.
